title: Surveying technician
overviewOfRole: Collecting information from site inspections to inform advice to clients on land, property or construction.
ssa1: 5 Construction, Planning and the Built Environment

knowledges.detail: C:Outline the English legal system, law of contract and law of tort
C:Explain key mathematical principles, principles of measurement, the importance of accuracy, data management and confidentiality
C:Be aware of economic principles and the operation of economic and property/construction markets
C:Describe the principles and responsibilities imposed by law, codes of practice and other regulations
C:Explain how and why sustainability seeks to balance economic, environmental and social objectives
C:Describe the technology of low rise buildings including materials
C:Explain how to manage own time and tasks, communicate and negotiate effectively
Oa:Describe the reasons for valuations and the methods to provide both capital and rental valuation advice
Ob:Be aware of common building defects including collection of information, measurement and tests
Oc:Explain principles of land law, the law of landlord and tenant and planning law
Od:Describe the main types of procurement and tendering and the various forms of contract used in the construction industry
Oe:Be aware of the principles of quantification and costing of construction works and how cost planning assists in the financial control of projects

behaviours.detail: Always ensure you provide the best possible service, ensure you give attention to detail and meet all deadlines set
Act in a professional and positive manner at all times
Be honest and straightforward in all that you do.
Treat everyone with courtesy, politeness and respect
Be accountable for all your actions

skills.detail: C:Measure and collect data relevant to the surveying discipline
C:Demonstrate the application of health and safety issues and the requirements for compliance
C:Apply the principles of construction technology and the environmental performance of materials
C:Apply the principles of contract law to include either contracts for acquisition/disposal of property, standard forms of building contracts or other property related contracts
C:Manage own time and tasks, communicate and negotiate effectively

Oa:Undertake capital and rental valuations and demonstrate involvement with the preparation of client reports.  Use a variety of valuation methods and techniques and use the relevant valuation standards and guidance
Ob:Undertake surveys, using survey and other information to diagnose cause and mechanisms of failure
Oc:Apply the law and practice relating to at least two of land, property, landlord and tenant or planning
Od:Implement procurement routes selected for projects and carrying out tendering processes relevant to them
Oe:Quantification, costing and cost management of construction works, including the use of appropriate standard methods of measurement and forms of cost analysis.

optionsUnstructuredTemplate: Land Surveying Technician (including rural, minerals and waste management and planning and development)
involvedEmployers: Gardiner and Theobald, Axis, DTZ, Faithorn Farrell Timms, DSB Construction Consultants, Valuation Office Agency, Transport for London, EC Harris, Martin Arnold Associates, Collier & Madge & CBRE

optionsUnstructuredKsbMapping.coreOrOptionTitle: Land Surveying Technician (including rural, minerals and waste management and planning and development)
